description:
Location:  Remote; Preference for San Francisco, Chicago, Dallas, or Houston office locations.
Company Overview: 
Leeward Renewable Energy (LRE) is a growth-oriented renewable energy company that owns and operates a portfolio of 24 renewable energy facilities across nine states, totaling more than 2,500 MW of installed capacity. We are actively developing new wind, solar, and energy storage projects in energy markets across the U.S., with 20 GW of projects under development spanning over 100 projects. With projects currently under construction and soon to commence construction, we expect to commercialize over 1,000 MW of renewable energy projects in the next two years.
LRE is a portfolio company of OMERS Infrastructure, a preeminent global infrastructure investor and investment arm of OMERS, one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans with C$121 billion in net assets (as at December 31, 2021).
Job Summary: 
The Public Affairs Regional Manager will be responsible for implementing consistent public affairs processes, strategies, and tactics across LRE’s fleet of projects to minimize project risks, build support, brand awareness, community goodwill, ensure project approvals and generate higher project value.
The Public Affairs Regional Manager will manage public affairs activities, in coordination with legal, development, construction and operations, including public hearings, community meetings, key stakeholder relationships, influencer meetings, crisis communications, community giving, political contributions, project events and media coordination. The individual will be responsible for managing local external public affairs and public relations firms.
This candidate must have an understanding of utility-scale renewable energy development, familiarity with permitting processes and regulations in key energy markets, and experience implementing a Public Affairs program across all phases of development. The candidate should also have experience advocating and engaging with local community stakeholders to build project support, address opposition and resolve community concerns.
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Essential Functions: 

 Develop and implement consistent and effective public affairs processes, strategies, and tactics across all regional project assets in development, construction and operations
 Manage and support public hearings and community meetings, key stakeholder relationships, government and elected official meetings, influencer meetings, crisis communications, community giving and political contributions, project events
 Manage and support advocacy on local government policies, regulations, and fees that may impact or relate to projects (in coordination with Legal, Development, and Government Affairs)
 Develop communications materials including presentations, talking points, messaging, local project press releases, articles, project datasheets, project websites and events, in coordination with internal and external resources
 Build trusted professional relationships with the key local business, government, NGO and tribal stakeholders
 Manage internal cross-functional collaboration of Public Affairs programs, issue resolution and activities
 Manage local public affairs and public relations agencies to support successful implementation of stakeholder engagement strategies and goals
 Manage and coordinate community giving and political contributions in compliance with Leeward approval and regulatory guidelines
 Attend project team meetings, and stay current on all project issues
 As appropriate, represent Leeward Renewable Energy in Industry Organizations
 Visit key local project locations with project teams as needed to understand critical issues and establish relationships
 Manage local community issues during construction and operations
 Coordinate local project level public relations with support of Corporate Communications and local PR firm

Qualifications: 

 Graduate and/or Bachelors Degree in Public Affairs, Political Science, Communications or related field
 5-7 years’ experience in Public Affairs, Communications, Stakeholder Engagement
 Political campaign and advocacy experience a plus
 Experience managing and resolving complex utility-scale renewable project public affairs issues
 Proven track record successfully building relationships with community, local, state and federal government officials, NGOs and tribes to gain project support, minimize or eliminate opposition, build trust
 Experience managing and directing communications and public affairs agencies
 Demonstrated passion for renewable energy
 Evidence of strong strategic thinking, communication, planning, organization and execution
 Experience presenting in public meetings
 Results oriented and strong project management skills
 Self-motivated, able to work independently in a rapidly evolving business environment
 Successful track record as a team player, ability to work cross-functionally
 Proactive approach, able to anticipate issues and recommend solutions
 Demonstrated ability to manage projects, coordinate teams, and facilitate effective meetings
 Take direction and apply constructive feedback to improve work product

Physical Demands: 

 Position will require sitting for long periods of time as well as occasionally lifting up to twenty-pound boxes.

Leeward Management Services, LLC is committed to employing a diverse workforce, and provides equal employment opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

 401(k)
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Life insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

 Dallas, TX 75206: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Application Question(s):

 What industries have you worked in?

Education:

 Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

 political campaign and advocacy: 3 years (Preferred)
 Public Affairs, Communications, Stakeholder Engagement: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: One location

Overview 
 Now is the time to join us and make a difference. Be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives. Here at the American Heart Association, you matter and so does your career. 
 We are hiring an Associate Marketing & Communications Manager. The Associate Marketing & Communications Manager is responsible for developing, planning, and completing targeted marketing and communications activities for Voices for Healthy Kids and related projects. They are responsible for acting as marketing or communications representative for the project. Assists with administrative and coordination tasks for the team. 
 *This is a full time, benefits eligible grant funded position. Current funding is through approx. 6/30/25. * 
 The Association offers many resources to help you maintain work-life harmonization through your changing needs and life situations. To help you be successful, you will have access to Heart U, our award-winning corporate university, as well as training and support locally and through our National Center. 
 \#TheAHALife is our company culture, our way of life, reflecting our diversity and inclusion, our focus on work-life harmonization and our Guiding Values. Discover why you will Be Seen. Be Heard. Be Valued™ at the American Heart Association by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and at heart.org. 
 Responsibilities 
 Essential Job Duties: 
 
  Writes and edits documents and other communications as requested (blogs, talking points, FAQ's, emails, action alerts, presentations, and newsletters). Ensures that the project's vision of equity is built into all communications. Facilitates projects with Design Studio and vendors. 
  Crafts and updates collateral for Voices for Healthy Kids projects such as brochures, one-pagers, signage, ads, digital banners, presentations, etc. 
  Handles content creation and management for websites, social media posts, and all related campaigns ensuring Voices for Healthy Kids vision of equity is the driving force. Includes tracking and evaluation. 
  Ensures all promotions, communications and marketing campaigns meet AHA Voices for Healthy Kids or other specific project branding guidelines. Collaborates with assigned vendors to remain aligned with visual design requirements. 
  Assists with the administrative and project coordination as needed for meeting support, list management, reporting, tracking and project maintenance. 
 
 Qualifications 
 Minimum Qualifications: 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, Communications, or related area 
  Two years of experience in marketing, communications, or promotional campaign development 
  One year of project management experience, including managing multiple projects concurrently 
  Shown success in crafting marketing or promotion plans 
  Strong analytical skills with a shown ability to apply trend analysis, research, and other sources to turn data and information into actionable information 
  Proficient digital literacy including Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint and Excel) 
  Excellent interpersonal, written, presentation, and oral communications skills 
  Experience and curiosity about understanding of social determinants of health, equity, and a proven dedication to building equitable communities. 
 
 Preferred Experience: 
 
  Demonstrated understanding of advocacy/public policy, community organization/mobilization, media/communications, and grassroots advocacy tactic development and implementation. 
 
 Compensation & Benefits 
 The American Heart Association invests in its people. Here are the main components of our total rewards package. Visit Rewards & Benefits to see more details. 
 
  Compensation – Our goal is to ensure you have a competitive base salary. That’s why we regularly review the market value of jobs and make adjustments, as needed. 
  Performance and Recognition – You are rewarded for achieving success by merit increases and incentive programs, based on the type of position. 
  Benefits – We offer a wide array of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance, along with a robust retirement program that includes an employer match and automatic contribution. As a mark of our commitment to employee well-being, we also offer an employee assistance program, employee wellness program and telemedicine, and medical consultation. 
  Professional Development – You can join one of our many Employee Resource Groups (ERG) or be a mentor/mentee in our professional mentoring program. HeartU is the Association’s national online university, with more than 100,000 resources designed to meet your needs and busy schedule. 
  Work-Life Harmonization – The Association offers Paid Time Off (PTO) at a minimum of 16 days per year for new employees. The number of days will increase based on seniority level. You will also have a total of 12 paid holidays off each year, which includes several days off at the end of the year. 
 
 The American Heart Association’s 2024 Goal: Every person deserves the opportunity for a full, healthy life. As champions for health equity, by 2024, the American Heart Association will advance cardiovascular health for all, including identifying and removing barriers to health care access and quality. 
 At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity applies to both our workforce and the communities we serve as it relates to heart health and stroke prevention. 
 This position not a match with your skills? Click here to see other opportunities.

Reporting to the Region Leader, the Public Relations Director is the leader of the regional marketing communications team, which delivers against Concern & Awareness goals while supporting the full mission of the organization. This position is largely responsible for maintaining concern about the disease and increasing awareness of the Alzheimer’s Association by garnering local editorial news coverage. Media relations is approximately 60% of this position.
  The Public Relations Director works closely with the leaders throughout the region to develop strategic marketing communications support for our Care & Support, Research, Public Policy, Development and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion initiatives. The Public Relations Director also sits on the Nationwide Marketing Council composed of Public Relations leads from each region.
  Responsibilities
  Essential functions and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  Core Job Responsibilities
 
   Collaborate with the Regional Leader and local leadership to develop, execute and evaluate regional and community communications opportunities that complement the Alzheimer’s Association national strategic plan.
   Manage year-round, community-wide media relations strategy and implementation, including:
   Leveraging and/or developing full mission story ideas and key messaging that aligns with the mission and brand of the Alzheimer's Association;
   Cultivating close relationships with local media across media types and at diverse outlets so that they are responsive to story ideas and turn to the Association when they have dementia-related needs;
   Ensuring staff and volunteer spokespeople are prepared, equipped and empowered to represent the Association with a clear mission narrative when appropriate;
   Pro-actively inserting the Alzheimer’s Association into relevant trends and creating new opportunities;
   Collaborating with the Home Office to manage and issue communications;
   Sharing content and supporting Media Relations staff throughout the region as they pursue their strategic goals.
   Oversee and, in areas where there is not additional media relations staff, also manage social media accounts (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.) as appropriate, including:
   Leveraging editorial calendar to plan full mission content;
   Identifying paid social opportunities that complement traditional paid and/or donated efforts;
   Analyzing insights to evaluate engagement and optimize posts.
   Manage the regional Marketing Manager in promoting strategic initiatives across marketing communications channels, including:
   Maintaining digital platforms to maximize brand awareness and ensure a positive user experience;
   Writing and editing content for weekly e-newsletter;
   Negotiating media buys and/or donations with local media outlets, including resizing of existing creative on provided design platforms;
   Leveraging and/or developing print and digital collateral as necessary to reach target audiences.
   Assure compliance with all Alzheimer’s Association branding policies, procedures, standards and applicable regulatory requirements.
 
  Key Educational/Professional Requirements
 
   Degree in relevant field.
   Ten years’ experience in communications and public relations.
   Five years’ experience working with social media and marketing communications.
   Five years management level experience.
   Experience working with local media outlets and securing editorial coverage in this market.
   Experience negotiating media buys and securing donated media.
   Experience with healthcare communications is ideal.
 
  Key Professional Attributes
 
   Understanding of the importance of consistent branding and messaging within a mission-based organization.
   Superior written and verbal skills.
   Creative thinking to ensure fresh approaches to annual and evergreen opportunities.
   Solution-oriented with strong decision-making skills, demonstrating effective cost/benefit analysis.
   Ability to motivate and encourage others to maximize potential and achieve challenging organization goals.
   Management skills, including the ability to set milestones against goals, organize projects, establish and manage budgets, develop work processes and supervise professionals.
   Strong awareness of the social, economic, political environment in which the Association operates.
 
  Position Title: Public Relations Director
  Position Location: Dallas, TX
  Full time or Part time: Full Time based on 37.5 hours per week minimum
  Position Grade: 209 Exempt
  Reports To: Region Leader
  Who We Are:
  The Alzheimer’s Association is the leading voluntary health organization in Alzheimer’s care, support and research. Our mission is to lead the way to end Alzheimer's and all other dementia- by accelerating global research, driving risk reduction and early detection, and maximizing quality care and support.
  At the Alzheimer’s Association, our employees are at the core of all we do. Our network of more than 1,900 employees across the United States makes a difference each and every day for those impacted by Alzheimer’s and those at risk for the disease.
  We warmly invite qualified applicants to consider this opportunity to make a life-changing impact on the millions living with Alzheimer’s, their caregivers and those that may develop the disease in the future. Read on to learn more about the role, then visit our website www.alz.org/jobs to explore who we are and why we've been recognized as a Best Place to Work for the last twelve years in a row.
  At the Alzheimer's Association®, we believe that diverse perspectives are critical to achieving health equity - meaning that all communities have a fair and just opportunity for early diagnosis and access to risk reduction and quality care. The Association is committed to engaging underrepresented and underserved communities and responding with resources and education to address the disproportionate impact of Alzheimer’s and dementia.
  The Alzheimer’s Association is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
  Employees working 24 hours/week or more are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, flex accounts, short and long-term disability, life insurance, long term care insurance, tuition reimbursement, generous Paid Time Off, 12 annual holidays and Paid Family Leave, as well as an annual Cultural & Heritage Day and Volunteer Day of their choosing. They are also eligible for our gold standard 401(k) retirement plan.
  Full time employees (37.5 hours/week), will enjoy all of the above plus an annual School Visitation Day and an Elder Care Facility Day of their choosing.

Hill+Knowlton Strategies is seeking a Fellow to join the US team for an immediate start. This is an opportunity to grow as a communications professional within a global network of energized communications experts. In this role, the individual will be working with a client in sustainability and the fashion supply chain.  The ideal candidate will be well-organized, proactive, and comfortable working with colleagues at a variety of levels as well as interacting with clients. Ideally, this person will be passionate about storytelling, brand purpose, and trends, and willing to quickly learn and apply best-in-class communications skills to support your teams.
  What You’ll Be Doing:
 
   Conduct in-depth research and compile detailed informational briefs covering a wide array of issues
   Help track product inventory for select accounts and manage sample deliveries to media. This will require visiting client offices from time to time.
   Provide support in the creation of presentation deliverables to clients
   Create media monitoring reports and compile media analysis around client issues and topics
   Maintain media lists, research reporters, and craft media pitches
   Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members across the consumer network
   Assist in the coordination of select in-person events & meetings and virtual events
   Learn through a rich curriculum of professional development and training opportunities
   Contribute your unique ideas and personality to the vibrant H+K company culture
 
  Qualifications:
 
   Strong communication skills with either an undergraduate degree or transferable practical experience
   Strong writing and research skills; extremely well-organized
   Interest in purpose-driven communication and consumer storytelling
   Digital and social media savvy as well as an avid news-junkie
   Proven ability to work collaboratively and take direction from team members
   Comfortable working on fast-paced assignments and willing to go above and beyond
   Experience with tools such as Cision and TV Eyes preferred, but not required
 
  ================
  About
  H+K Strategies is one of the world’s largest and most renowned communications firms, with more than 85 offices around the globe.
  At H+K here in the U.S., our first priority is our people and creating an experience for each employee that is positive and fulfilling. Do you like being able to work from anywhere and in a way that is best for your life? Come join us at H+K. Do you like working for the industry’s most exciting clients and supporting headline-grabbing programs? Come join us at H+K. Do you like working with nice people? Come join us at H+K. Do you like industry-best benefits, vacation time, wellness time, and parental leave? You guessed it, come join us at H+K.
  Come join us at H+K. Where we believe in the power of “Being” everything that our employees need us to be – creating a work life that is all about Being Flex, Being Connected, Being Well, Being Empowered, and Being Valued. And we keep innovating and evolving our employee experience based on what we hear directly from our team members because we strive to be the absolute best place to work.
  So let’s recap, what to expect if you were to work at H+K:
 
   Nice, passionate colleagues and a supportive work culture
   Flexible work modes program, where you can choose whether you work from home, work from the office, or a mix of both – a completely hybrid, distributed workforce
   Exciting clients and opps to stretch up and across to grow within the company
   Competitive compensation
   Amazing, industry-best benefits, such as
 
 
   Comprehensive and inclusive health, dental, vision, and mental healthcare
   Back-up care paid parental leave (16-week maternity leave!), and other family solutions
   Retirement savings and student loan refinancing partner options
 
 
   Insanely good vacation and wellness time off, no matter your level
   Plus, another engaging employee programming, such as
 
 
   Ally and Mentorship program
   Employee Resource Groups
   Employee Experience committees
   And, worth mentioning, frequent happy hours 
 
 Most importantly! As an Equal Opportunity Employer, H+K Strategies does not discriminate against applicants or employees because of their race, creed, color, age, religion, sex, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military status, national origin, or ancestry.
  COME JOIN US!

Enhabit Home Health & Hospice is hiring a Chief Investor Relations Officer to join our team in Dallas, TX. This role is responsible for creating and presenting a consistently applied message to the investment community on behalf of Enhabit. The Chief Investor Relations Office is responsible for monitoring and presenting to management the opinions of the investment community.
 
 
 
   Enhabit was formerly a part of Encompass Health Corp., its parent company, founded in 1998 and focused on inpatient rehabilitation, home health and hospice operations. In January 2022, Encompass announced it intended to spin off the home health & hospice segment into a new, publicly traded company under the name Enhabit Home Health & Hospice. Enhabit went public on July 1, 2022.
 
  Responsibilities
 
   Serve as the key point of contact for the investment community.
   Develop an annual investor relations plan.
   Monitor the type and mix of shareholders; conduct targeting initiatives to revise the mix.
   Monitor operational changes through ongoing contact with management.
   Understand Regulation Fair Disclosure; promote it throughout the company and investment community.
   Develop investor relations messages and create communication materials (press releases, presentations, etc…) for earnings releases, industry events, capital transactions, investor conferences/meetings, and other events.
   Oversee production of the annual report.
   Manage the investor relations portion of the company website.
   Monitor analyst reports and summarize them for management.
   Maintain relationships with analysts, investors, stock exchange representatives, company management and board of directors.
   Organize conferences, road shows, earnings conference calls, and investor meetings.
   Prepare practice questions (with answers when needed) and lead practice sessions with management for investor meetings and earnings calls.
   Report on the investment community’s perception of company affairs and financial results.
   Collaborate with management on decisions that will create or destroy value for shareholders, including stock repurchase programs and dividend changes.
   Create periodic feedback reports about the Company’s stock price, analysts’ estimates, analysts’ perceptions, industry and peer company performance, and the stock market in general to management and the board of directors.
   Serve as a spokesperson for the company’s crisis communication team.
   Develop and monitor the budget for the investor relations department.
   Maintain the highest level of discretion in dealing with sensitive, nonpublic information.
   Supervise the Investor Relations department.
 
  Qualifications
 
   Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree preferred
   Must have 15 or more years of experience practicing finance with strong financial and analytical skills
   Experience with large, public corporations preferably in the healthcare industry
   Knowledge of capital markets, financial performance metrics, and financial statements
   Knowledge of SEC rules and regulations
   Ability to effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders
   Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills
   Ability to collaborate with management
 
 
 

 
  If you have issues uploading your resume, you can email it directly to Stacy Weightman, Senior Executive Talent Consultant - 
  stacy.weightman@ehab.com
 
 
 
   Enhabit Home Health & Hospice is an equal opportunity employer. We work to promote differences in a collaborative and respectful manner. We are committed to a work environment that supports, encourages and motivates all individuals without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, disability, national or ethnic origin, military service status, citizenship, genetic information, or other protected characteristic. At Enhabit, we celebrate and embrace the special differences that makes our community extraordinary.

The Corporate Communications Specialist will be a part of the corporate communications team responsible for creating, managing and implementing strategic communications campaigns to enrich Children’s Health communications for employees, physicians and patient families. This position will support communications for the Northern Market’s/Dallas Market’s business strategy and various strategic initiatives across all stakeholders. The ability to distill and simplify complex information for a variety of audiences is vital for this role. The role will support town hall forums, internal communications programs, external positioning, story mining for PR efforts and more. Candidates should be self-motivated, eager to learn, passionate about pediatric health care, people-oriented and thoughtful. 
This is a full-time position working Monday through Friday in a remote capacity. (Will require you to come onsite to hospital campuses and administrative buildings as needed) 
Responsibilities 

 
 Support strategic communication plans for Market expansion initiatives, issues and events with high complexity that affect employees and patient families of Children's Health. 
 Possess and utilize strong writing skills for internal newsletters, executive remarks, talking points and patient family materials 
 Develop communications plans that support hospital expansion and clinical program growth for communicating internally and externally 
 Story mine for potential social or media stories about team members and patient families on the hospital campus, collaboration with External Communications team for posting and pitching 
 Effectively communicate Children's Health mission, strategic direction, key messages and positioning to achieve business objectives. 
 Assess communication needs among employees throughout Children's Health. Interact with hospital employees and evaluate communication effectiveness. 
 Plan and implement corporate communications programs designed to effectively communicate to 7,500 employees and also patient families. 
 Communicate market and/or system changes and understand organizational implications. 
 Support the strategy and execution of various meeting forums, including town halls, leadership meetings and more 
 Help to clarify the market's strategy as it relates to the mission and enterprise strategy. 
 Creates strategic Powerpoint Presentations to support town halls, campaigns, etc. 
 Experience 
3 years of previous work experience in internal, employee, corporate, non-profit/agency communications; in house, agency/nonprofit public relations and excellent writing skills is required. 
In house corporate communications experience with understanding of organizational structure and supporting leadership communications and communicating to variety of stakeholders preferred. 

 Education 
Four-year Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, required. 

 About us 
Children’s Health values the role each member of our team plays in helping us make life better for children. We employ more than 7,500 people and provide rewarding career opportunities that help them reach their highest potential. 
We also hold Magnet recognition from the American Nurses Credentialing Center for nursing excellence, we serve as the primary pediatric teaching facility for the University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center , and we are widely recognized for delivering high quality care . 
Children’s Health has also been named one of the 150 Top Places to Work in Healthcare by Becker’s Healthcare for nine consecutive years. 
We invite you to learn more about Children’s Health. 
Benefits 
Children’s Health offers competitive pay, a comprehensive benefits program and opportunities for learning and career development. We promote a diverse and inclusive workplace, and our team members have a voice in their work through surveys and town halls.

Job Description:
  About Our Company:
  Here at Dream Front we understand the importance of leading from the front, and that’s exactly where we aim for our clients to be! Representing some of the world’s leading brands provides us with the leverage to take ourselves, customers and clients to the next level. Our event marketing solutions brings our clients’ product or service straight to the customer in the form of interactive displays and promotions. 
 Dream is seeking a Communications Associate to help ensure clear communication of our company’s message across all channels. In this role, a successful candidate should be a great communicator with strong organizational abilities. 
 Salary $33.50 an hour Job Type Full-time 
 Responsibilities:
 
   Plan and implement a communications strategy. 
  Organize and direct promotional events. 
  Recommend techniques to improve the company’s public image. 
  Identify and resolve any issues with promotional content in a timely and professional manner. 
  Serve as point of contact for media and public questions. 
  Assess and report on the effectiveness of communication strategies. 
  Preserve customer data for both current and new customers 
 
  
 Required Experience:
 
   High school diploma or GED. 
  Proficient in all Microsoft Office applications. 
  Sound knowledge of marketing principles and techniques. 
  Excellent organizational and analytical skills. 
  Effective communication skills. 
 
  From: Rox
  
  
 Benefits:
 
   Medical insurance 
  Life insurance 
  Retirement plan 
  Disability insurance

Overview 
 Now is the time to join us and make a difference. Be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives. Here at American Heart Association, you matter and so does your career. 
 American Heart Association has an excellent opportunity for a National Executive Lead, Marketing Communications, Donor Engagement in our Mission Advancement department! 
 This position can be home based. 
 The Association offers many resources to help you maintain work-life harmonization through your changing needs and life situations. To help you be successful, you will have access to Heart U, our award-winning corporate university, as well as training and support locally and through our National Center. 
 \#TheAHALife is our company culture, our way of life, reflecting our diversity and inclusion, our focus on work-life harmonization and our Guiding Values. Discover why you will Be Seen. Be Heard. Be Valued™ at the American Heart Association by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and at heart.org. 
 Responsibilities 
 Mission Advancement is a revenue development department of American Heart Association which raises over $200M annually for the mission, with a focus on major, principal, and planned gifts, as well as government grants. This individual is a key player and mentor, supervising a fast-paced, highly productive, and resourceful team of dedicated professionals. Leading a 5-person team and collaborating across the organization as well as with agencies and vendors, the National Executive Lead ensures the highest possible level of engagement through a data- and heart-driven omnichannel approach reaching hundreds of thousands of current and prospective donors annually. Responsibilities include developing and driving marketing and communications plans, strategies, and tactics in support of our Cor Vitae and Paul Dudley White Legacy Society Giving Societies, for our Professional Advisor Network, and other cultivation and stewardship initiatives led by Mission Advancement, such as non-cash asset giving marketing, and connect with the CEO, an exclusive invitation-only virtual gathering focused on groundbreaking information and announcements. This position provides leadership for training across Mission Advancement as well as specific initiatives of the AHA, to optimize talent and revenue opportunities. 
 
  Manage input and collaborates with stakeholders to develop, handle estimates, production, and budgets, implement, and provide return on investment reporting for strategic marketing and communications plans crafted to engage and develop revenue from a variety audiences and segments. Lead staff and projects toward timely, compelling and cost-effective execution, and regularly report on the status and results of plans 
  Research, identify best-practices, develop strategies and execute generation of donor leads for planned gift commitments. Implement primarily print marketing outreach to top segments of prospective donors. Lead all aspects of data collection and reporting 
  Plan, develop and own the production of print and digital donor content, materials and donor recognition through vehicles such as newsletters, ads, scripting, programs, event materials, reports, presentations, web content, templates, email marketing and automated email journeys. Develop and execute tradeshow marketing strategies, including onsite supervision 
  Supervise training schedules and provide expertise in planning, development and production of all department-wide training and select Association trainings 
  Lead and implement communication and media relations for select gifts and opportunities to include collaborating with the Office of the CEO, National Corporate Communications, and local communication staff 
  Develop and lead intra- and inter-departmental communication, resource delivery, and team meetings 
  Contribute to the leadership of the Grants and Operations Division of Mission Advancement 
 
 Qualifications 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience 
  Eight (8) to Twelve (12) years of meaningful experience 
  Experience in broad oversight of marketing, public relations/media relations, internal communications, major gift and/or sponsor development 
  Fundraising experience with large individual giving audience or major gifts and donors 
  Supervisory experience 
  Print marketing experience 
  Ability to navigate solutions and projects with a large number of collaborators 
  Ability to develop and implement strategic marketing and communications plans 
  Ability to communicate complex information so that it may be understood by the public 
  Strong writing and editing skills 
  Ability to travel up to 20% local and overnight stay 
 
 Preferred Experience: 
 
  Experience supporting success of co-branded initiatives and donor activation 
  Prior experience marketing planned gifts 
  Prior experience at a non-profit, with national level experience 
  Advertising or public relations agency experience 
  Experience supervising remote/home office staff 
 
 Compensation & Benefits 
 The American Heart Association invests in its people. Here are the main components of our total rewards package. Visit Rewards & Benefits to see more details. 
 
  Compensation – Our goal is to ensure you have a competitive base salary. That’s why we regularly review the market value of jobs and make adjustments, as needed. 
  Performance and Recognition – You are rewarded for achieving success by merit increases and incentive programs, based on the type of position. 
  Benefits – We offer a wide array of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance, along with a robust retirement program that includes an employer match and automatic contribution. As a mark of our commitment to employee well-being, we also offer an employee assistance program, employee wellness program and telemedicine, and medical consultation. 
  Professional Development – You can join one of our many Employee Resource Groups (ERG) or be a mentor/mentee in our professional mentoring program. HeartU is the Association’s national online university, with more than 100,000 resources designed to meet your needs and busy schedule. 
  Work-Life Harmonization – The Association offers Paid Time Off (PTO) at a minimum of 16 days per year for new employees. The number of days will increase based on seniority level. You will also have a total of 12 paid holidays off each year, which includes several days off at the end of the year. 
 
 The American Heart Association’s 2024 Goal: Every person deserves the opportunity for a full, healthy life. As champions for health equity, by 2024, the American Heart Association will advance cardiovascular health for all, including identifying and removing barriers to health care access and quality. 
 At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity applies to both our workforce and the communities we serve as it relates to heart health and stroke prevention. 
 This position not a match with your skills? Click here to see other opportunities. 
 Be sure to follow us on Twitter #TheAHALife

description:
Career Area: Finance 
 Job Description: 
 Your Work Shapes the World 
 Whether it be groundbreaking products, best-in-class solutions or creating a lifelong career, you can do the work that matters at Caterpillar. With a nearly century-long legacy of quality and technological innovation and 150 locations in countries around the world, your impact spans the globe. When you join Caterpillar, you are joining a team of makers, innovators and doers. We are the people who roll up our sleeves and help our customers build a better, more sustainable world. We don’t just talk about progress and innovation, we make it happen. And we are proud of that because it helps our customers build and power the world we live in – the roads, hospitals, homes and infrastructure. 
 There’s no better spot to gain broad perspectives of Caterpillar than joining our Investor Relations team to help highlight the great things we do and communicate our shareholder value to investors all over the world. The exciting role is based in our new global headquarters in Irving, TX. Join us! 
 Description: 
 As the Investor Relations Associate reporting to the Senior Investor Relations Manager, this role gains exposure to both executive-level management and investors at a Dow 30 company. You collaborate across a variety of groups across Caterpillar, including finance, accounting, communications and business divisions. This associate role supports the financial analysis function including analyst/consensus modeling expectations as compared to internal estimates. In addition, this role tracks and develops timely summaries when peer/competitor news breaks. Finally, the position will cultivate our communication plans to educate the market. 
 Job duties include but are not limited to the following: 
 This is an individual contributor role that reports to the Sr. Investor Relations Manager. Principal accountabilities may include: 
 
  Track and update key financial metrics for Caterpillar and peers, such as stock performance (share price, total shareholder return), trading multiples (e.g., P/E, EV/EBITDA), operating metrics (sales growth, margins, cash flow, balance sheet, etc.) 
  Monitor and report on sell-side analyst/consensus expectations including creation of a monthly dashboard 
  Monitor peers and competitors, including use of Alphasense to distribute brief updates to management 
  Propose communication plan to address any gaps versus expectations for use in earnings scripts and Q&A 
  Maintain and expand use of PowerBI system dashboards used for targeting, financial analysis and investor profiling leveraging Factset and BD Corporate systems 
  Update consensus expectations periodically and provide related analyst level analysis 
  Support IR website update to best-in-class investor experience 
  Monitor, evaluate/research and propose responsive communications to investor inquiries 
 
 Employee may also be responsible for performing other job duties occasionally as assigned. 
 Basic Requirements: 
 
  At least 2 years of previous finance or accounting experience 
  BA in finance, business administration or other relevant concentration 
  Good communication and collaboration skills are required to develop a cooperative work relationship with others inside and outside the department 
  Understanding of the financial markets and the U.S. investment community 
  Strong presentation creation skills including PowerPoint slides and Excel charting 
 
 Top Candidate Will Also Have: 
 
  The incumbent must have strong financial analysis and communications skills 
  Investor Relations experience is a plus, but not required 
  PowerBI skills are a plus 
 
 Additional Details: 
 
  Location: Irving, TX 
  Domestic relocation is available for those who qualify 
  Moderate travel required (up to 15% of working time) 
 
 Employee benefit details: 
 Our goal at Caterpillar is for you to have a rewarding career. Our teams are critical to the success of our customers who build a better world. 
 Here you earn more than just a salary, because we value your performance. We offer a total rewards package that provides day one benefits [medical, dental, vision, RX, and 401(k)] along with the potential of an annual bonus. 
 Additional benefits include paid vacation days and paid holidays (prorated based upon hire date). 
 Final details: 
 Please frequently check the email associated with your application, including the junk/spam folder, as this is the primary correspondence method. If you wish to know the status of your application – please use the candidate log-in on our career website as it will reflect any updates to your status. 
 This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S. which can be found through our employment website at www.Caterpillar.com/Careers 
 #LI 
 EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply. 
 Not ready to apply? Submit your information to our Talent Network here .

Qualifications 
  Job Overview 
  As the Vice President, Communications and Marketing, you will be responsible for leading the DFW Airport overall communication strategy in support of the Airport’s Strategic Plan. Under the leadership of the Executive Vice President of Administration and Diversity, you will also provide leadership to a talented team of professionals who develop and implement global strategies to promote DFW Airport. You’ll have the opportunity to interact with and influence key leaders within the airport and across the community to spread the message about key initiatives that drive over 37 billion dollars in economic output for the North Texas region
   What you will be doing:
   
   Develop communications and marketing strategies to maximize the airport’s reputation amongst its customers and stakeholders in the industry, community, and workplace. 
   Inform and influence DFW Airport’s employees, customers and stakeholders through internal and external communications, social, digital, and traditional media, marketing, issues management, and crisis response. 
   Develop and execute marketing programs in support of Airport priorities and revenue-generating initiatives. 
   Collaborate across internal stakeholders and groups to support business initiatives. 
   Develop effective working relationships with CEO, executives, and senior staff to support the achievement of business goals. 
   Implement community engagement programs, to broaden and enhance key stakeholder’s advocacy and support through outreach, engagement and employee involvement while ensuring regulatory compliance. 
   Develop and maintain positive relationships with business partners such as chambers of commerce, business advocacy groups, CVBs, regulatory agencies and collaborates on messaging with airlines as necessary.
  
   What you need: 
  
   Bachelor’s degree in public relations, communications, journalism, liberal arts, or a related field. 
   Ten (10) years of experience in corporate communications, public relations, or print or broadcast media. 
   Seven (7) years of management experience. 
   Any equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be substituted for the above. 
   Possession of a valid class C driver’s license.
  
   What we desire: 
  
   Master’s degree in Communications, Public Affairs, Law, or Government. 
   Experience in more than one role related to communications, marketing or public relations 
   Experience in public policy disciplines. 
   Airport or aviation industry experience. 
   PRSA Certification of other relevant Public Relations certifications.
  
   About Us
   We are Dallas Fort Worth International (DFW) Airport—one of the most successful airports in the world by any definition. We’re recognized for our innovation, leadership, drive for excellence and talented employees, and over the past five years we achieved almost every strategic objective and performance goal that we set out to achieve. 
  Our success is made possible because of the diverse talents of nearly 2,000 employees who champion our mission of providing an exceptional Airport experience to our customers and connect our community to the world. We’re looking for the best talent to join our Treasury Management Department and help us re-imagine what an airport can be. 
  Bring your talents to DFW and live and work with purpose.

Senior Marketing Coordinator 
  - 
  (
  170419
  )
 
 
   Description
  
   About Us 
  At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.  Watch Our Story:' https://www.hdrinc.com/our-story'   We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. 
  Primary Responsibilities 
  In the role of Senior Marketing Coordinator, we'll count on you to: 
  
   Conceptualize, research and produce marketing materials, proposals, promotions and presentations 
   Write non-technical text, and edit and proofread all marketing communications 
   Provide storyboarding and message development for strategic pursuits 
   Be responsible for timely production and quality of marketing communications 
   Actively participate in content for business class and marketing materials development 
   Coordinate trade show participation 
   Develop conference concepts, promotions and artwork, and coordinate booth activities 
   Act in Project Manager role as needed 
   Coordinate public involvement events as needed 
   Perform other duties as needed 
   
  #LI-LA1
  
    
  
 
 
   Qualifications
  
   Required Qualifications 
  
   Bachelor's degree 
   3 years of experience 
   Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
   Works cooperatively with diverse teams, regional, department, national, technical managers and project staff 
   Committed to quality, improvement and HDR values 
   Requires little or no direction in area of specialization 
   Must exhibit proficient technical computer skills, advanced knowledge of communication theory and basic layout and design principles 
   Good interpersonal and communication skills 
   Excellent organizational and customer service skills 
   Demonstrates understanding of market and public relations 
   An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must 
   
  Preferred Qualifications 
  
   Preference given to local candidates 
   Indesign (basic layout and design principles) experience preferred 
   
  Why HDR 
  At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.
  
  
    
  
 
 
   Primary Location
  : United States-Texas-Dallas
 
 
   Industry
  : Marketing
 
 
   Schedule
  : Full-time
 
 
   Employee Status
  : Regular
 
 
   BusinessClass
  : Marketing and Admin
 
 
   Job Posting
  : Nov 14, 2022

Career Area: Communications 
 Job Description: 
 Why Caterpillar: 
 Whether it be groundbreaking products, best-in-class solutions or creating a lifelong career, you can do the work that matters at Caterpillar. With a nearly century-long legacy of quality and technological innovation and 150 locations in countries around the world, your impact spans the globe. When you join Caterpillar, you are joining a team of makers, innovators and doers. We are the people who roll up our sleeves and help our customers build a better, more sustainable world. We don’t just talk about progress and innovation, we make it happen. And we are proud of that because it helps our customers build and power the world we live in – the roads, hospitals, homes and infrastructure. 
 There’s no better spot to gain broad perspectives of Caterpillar than joining our Investor Relations team to help highlight the great things we do and communicate our shareholder value to investors all over the world. The exciting role is based in our new global headquarters in Irving, TX. Join us! 
 What You’ll Do: 
 As the Investor Relations Manager reporting to the Vice President, do work that makes an impact as this critical IR role gains exposure to both executive-level management and investors at a Dow 30 company. You will collaborate across a variety of groups at Caterpillar, including finance, accounting, communications and business divisions. This manager role leads the financial analysis function, maintains ESG-related communications amongst the teams and develops high quality presentations to engage with senior leadership. Moderate travel required at times (up to 15% of the time). 
 Some job responsibilities include: 
 • Financial analysis leadership (50-75% of time) 
 o Closely monitor and report on key financial metrics for Caterpillar and peers, such as stock performance (share price, total shareholder return), trading multiples (P/E, EV/EBITDA), operating metrics (sales growth, margins, cash flow, balance sheet, etc.) 
 o Create executive-level slide presentations for use with Board, Executive Office and investor events, including Investor Day and board and executive meetings 
 o Monitor Caterpillar sell-side analyst reports, create daily overviews (when applicable) to share with senior management. During earnings season, develop likely analyst focus areas 
 o Track, develop and create summaries from market and industry-related information 
 o Implement and leverage automated tools, such as FactSet, to streamline data access and reporting 
 o Monitor Investor Relations best practices and implement where possible. Keep team apprised of National Investor Relations Institute and Rivel key trends and IR benchmarking 
 • Environmental Social Governance (ESG) (25-50% of time, depending upon the time of the year) 
 o Create ESG proxy call talk-track documents and prep documents for senior management 
 o Develop and manage key takeaways from ESG-related shareholder engagement 
 o Update activism preparedness plan annually 
 o Will proactively interact with leaders in Sustainability and SEC-Legal teams 
 Who You Are: 
 
  Strong financial analysis and communications skills are required 
 
 
  Understanding of the financial markets and the U.S. investment community 
 
 
  Excellent communication and collaboration skills to engage across the enterprise 
 
 
  Exceptional presentation creation skills and capabilities are required; FactSet and PowerBI skills are a plus 
 
 
  At least five to seven years of previous finance or accounting experience is preferred 
 
 
  Investor Relations experience is a plus, but not required 
 
 
  BA in finance, business administration or other relevant concentration is preferred 
 
 Employee Benefit Details: 
 Our goal at Caterpillar is for you to have a rewarding career. Our teams are critical to the success of our customers who build a better world. 
 Here you earn more than just a salary because we value your performance. We offer a total rewards package that provides benefits on day one (medical, dental, vision, RX, and 401K) along with the potential of an annual bonus. 
 Additional benefits include paid vacation days and paid holidays (prorated based upon hire date). 
 Final details: 
 Please frequently check the email associated with your application, including the junk/spam folder, as this is the primary correspondence method. If you wish to know the status of your application – please use the candidate log-in on our career website as it will reflect any updates to your status. 
 This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S. which can be found through our employment website at www.Caterpillar.com/Careers . 
 For more information, visit caterpillar.com. To connect with us on social media, visit caterpillar.com/social-media

description:
Witherite Law Group is a personal injury law firm specializing in motor vehicle accidents. Our vision is to improve the life of each person we serve. Whether it is for our employees, our clients, or our community, WLG puts people first, provides unmatched expertise, and displays integrity in every situation.
 
  Our attorneys and staff are committed to helping injured clients get the care and service they deserve. We take care of the complex legal work so that our clients can focus on recovery and getting their lives back. We aredetermined to help our clients get the settlement they deserve, and we will be by our client’s side every step of the way.
 
  This firm is a Top 100 Places to Work recipient and a National Top Workplace honoree. We are proud of these achievements and honored to be among this prestigious list of companies. Our culture is special. But you can’t just take our word for it...apply today and join the WLG family.
 
  Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
  The Digital Marketing Specialist is a junior-level digital marketer that assists the digital marketing team with all related tasks. The duties of a Digital Marketing Specialist include performing administrative tasks, conducting market research, updating databases, and writing content for the company web pages.
 
   Assist our Marketing team with day-to-day execution of marketing campaign tasks including website updates, maintenance and SEO
 
 
   Assist with scheduling and coordination of projects using approved skills and methods. 
  Track success of website updates to optimize performance against key KPIs using various online resources and tools 
  Responsible for keyword tracking and reporting, search console analysis, competitor analysis, content optimization, metadata analysis
   Support creation, maintenance, and communication of project plans, including schedules, milestones, and budget recommendations for key marketing initiatives 
  Excellent organizational skills with outstanding attention to detail and excellent follow-through
   Professional appearance and behavior
   Good verbal and written communication skills on the phone, in person and email
   Excellent time management, multi-tasking, and critical thinking abilities
   Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite 
  Perform other duties as assigned
 
  Above all, the best candidate will demonstrate an enthusiasm for the position and a willingness to learn. Success in this role means having the opportunity to learn and grow within the company and the potential to build excellent website development and SEO skills.
  Experience Requirements:
 
   A willingness to learn
   Have strong drive 
  Ability to take initiative 
  Strong written and oral communication skills 
  Highly organized
   Excellent project management skills with superior attention to detail
   Can take high level direction and ‘run with it’, using critical thinking skills to move projects forward in an efficient and effective manner
   Must be a problem solver with a guerilla-marketing mindset
   Thrives in a high-energy, fast-paced environment
 
  Education Requirements:
 
   Bachelor’s degree (or a pending four year degree) in marketing, advertising, public relations, business administration is required
 
  Physical Requirements:
 
   Office environment with normal business hours necessary to satisfactorily perform job functions. 
  Stand/Sit – Must be able to remain in a stationary position up to 50% of the time.
   Walk – This position needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, meeting rooms, office machinery, etc.
   Use of hands/fingers to handle or feel – constantly operates a computer and other office machinery such as a copy machine/printer.
   Climbs stairs – May occasionally ascends/descends the stairs to get to other floors, cafeteria, and parking area. 
  Carry Weight/Lift - Occasionally moves supplies weighing up to 10 pounds for various presentation and event needs. 
 
 Disclaimer:
  Please note that this job description is subject to change with or without prior notice, and that a reasonable accommodation may be requested to perform the essential functions of the job.

Interested in a career with both meaning and growth? Whether your abilities are in direct patient care or one of the many other areas of healthcare administration and support, everyone at Parkland works together to fulfill our mission: the health and well-being of individuals and communities entrusted to our care. By joining Parkland, you become part of a diverse healthcare legacy that’s served our community for more than 125 years. Put your skills to work with us, seek opportunities to learn and join a talented team where patient care is more than a job. It’s our passion.
  
 
   Primary Purpose
  
 
  Plans, develops, and coordinates media activities to promote the visibility and positive image of Parkland, its work and mission in the community.
 
  
  
 
  Minimum Specifications
 
  
  
 
  Education
  
 
  Must have a bachelor’s degree in journalism, public relations, communications, or related field.
 
  
  
 
 
  Experience
  
 
  Must have six years of journalism, public relations, and/or corporate communications experience.
 
  
  
 
 
  Skills or Special Abilities
  
 
  Must have exceptional verbal and written communication skills, to include excellent writing skills for media pitches/press releases. 
  Must be able to demonstrate basic computer skills, 
  Must have good organizational and decision-making skills, and attention to detail. 
  Must be sensitive to political, cultural, and legal issues affecting hospital system operations. 
  Must be able to demonstrate ability to supervise.
 
  
  
 
 
  Responsibilities
  
 
  
   Selects, trains, schedules, motivates, supervises, and evaluates employees, making recommendations for disciplinary actions up to and including termination, to ensure maximum utilization of individual and group capabilities. Ensures that assigned employees receive opportunities to further their knowledge.
   
  
   Responsible for planning and implementation of long and short-term media goals. Develops new mechanisms for media relations.
   
  
   Serves as the departmental supervisor over media relations to promote the visibility and positive image of Parkland, its work and mission the community.
   
  
   Conducts proactive media relations. Places news articles in local, regional, and national news media. Prepares press releases and news alerts.
   
  
   Maintains one-on-one relationships with the news media and assists media representatives in newsgathering.
   
  
   Oversees the organization and execution of special media events, and promotion of communications activities to support the overall mission and goals of Parkland as directed by supervisor.
   
  
   Serves as a resource and liaison between the media and public relations, Administration, internal hospital system departments, physicians, employees, and patients, to provide verbal and written communications support.
   
  
   During internal disaster situations or significant media incidents, serves as back-up spokesperson for Parkland. Provides support to Director of Corporate Communications to assure timely response to media requests for information.
   
  
   Responsible for the coordination and oversight of Speaker’s Bureau including all follow-up activities related to speaking events, measuring effectiveness, and providing needed information to speakers in advance of the event.
   
  
   Stays abreast of latest trends and advancement in corporate and medical communications field to maximize department productivity and effectiveness by attending Parkland seminars/workshops, reading professional journals, and participating in professional organizations. Integrates new knowledge gained as appropriate into the job.
   
  
   Measures effectiveness of media activities, monitors and reports results and implements improvement measures as needed.
   
  
   Maintains knowledge of applicable rules, regulations, policies, laws, and guidelines that impact the Corporate Communications area. Develops effective controls that promote adherence to applicable state/federal laws, and the program requirements of accreditation agencies and federal, state, and private health plans. Seeks advice and guidance as necessary to ensure proper understanding.
  
 
  
  
 
 
  Job Accountabilities
  
 
  
   Identifies ways to improve work processes and improve customer satisfaction. Makes recommendations to supervisor, implements, and monitors results as appropriate in support of the overall goals of the department and Parkland.
   
  
   Stays abreast of the latest developments, advancements, and trends in the field by attending seminars/workshops, reading professional journals, actively participating in professional organizations, and/or maintaining certification or licensure. Integrates knowledge gained into current work practices.
   
  
   Maintains knowledge of applicable rules, regulations, policies, laws, and guidelines that impact the area. Develops effective internal controls designed to promote adherence with applicable laws, accreditation agency requirements, and federal, state, and private health plans. Seeks advice and guidance as needed to ensure proper understanding.
   
  
 
  Parkland Health and Hospital System prohibits discrimination based on age (40 or over), race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, disability, national origin, marital status, political belief, or veteran status.
